areaDesc.2: Rolling and wooded. Known as "West Wildwood."
areaDesc.3: Highly restricted.
areaDesc.4: Poor approach along Washington Road. Lacks transportation and school facilities.

11.a: Brick veneer singles at $14 M to $20 M

areaDesc.14: Sould be GREEN or "A" area if the approach were better and if transportation and school facilities were developed.

areaDesc.3: Near Park. Highly restricted. School and transportation facilities good.
areaDesc.14: Quiet section. No through traffic. Very desirable.

areaDesc.3: Restricted. Streets, sidewalks, ornamental light posts. Fair transportation (bus system).
areaDesc.4: Poor school facilities. Surrounding area unrestricted.
areaDesc.13: Will improve if provided transportation and schools.
areaDesc.14: Section developed after real estate recession had set in.

areaDesc.3: Favored by the area B-9. Ground less high.
areaDesc.4: Unrestricted and developed with shacks. No streets are paved. No utilities except electricity. Outside the city limits.
areaDesc.13: Cheap neighborhood for laborers. A few square type homes on Nuttman Avenue.
areaDesc.14: Predominating construction, balance of the district, completed by individuals in their spare time labor. No streets are paved.

areaDesc.3: Close to city center.
areaDesc.4: Railroads, factories, coal yards. Age and obsolecence.
areaDesc.14: We have extended the area somewhat north because of expansion of undesirable.

areaDesc.3: Convenient to business, schools and churches.
areaDesc.4: Unrestricted and slow of development. Scattered old type houses.
areaDesc.14: The area is surrounded by much better properties, tending to "pull up" the level of this area.

areaDesc.3: Boulevard street. Set back houses. Large lots. Good transportation and schools. Highly restricted.
areaDesc.14: Restricted and convenient to stores and shops. One block off the main north and south thoroughfare, Calhoun Street.

areaDesc.3: High ground. Good schools and good transportation. The Park is a help. Streets are paved.
areaDesc.13: Will maintain its own. May improve somewhat.

areaDesc.3: Good schools and transportation. Golf course and Park.
areaDesc.14: Nice section for persons of incomes as given.

areaDesc.4: Poor transportation. Poor school facilities. Unrestricted. No paving.
areaDesc.14: Undesirable area

areaDesc.3: Transportation, schools, churches and parks.
areaDesc.13: Area should maintain its present s tanding.
areaDesc.14: Very few, if any, properties for sale.

areaDesc.3: Old estates. Large lots; houses set back.
areaDesc.4: Surrounded by old section of the city.

6.b: 50% frame and 50% solid brick and stone.

areaDesc.14: Old large expensive homes; should hold up in value. Area of older industrialists and professional men who will probably live out their lives here.

areaDesc.2: Flat. East of Anthony Boulevard, the area is called "Pontiac Place."
areaDesc.3: Schools, parks and transportation. All paved streets.
areaDesc.14: Clean area, not affected by smoke or dirt.

areaDesc.3: Near Park. Highly restricted. Good school and transportation facilities.
areaDesc.14: Homes of the very wealthy. More or less 5 acre estates.

areaDesc.3: Low taxes. Outside the city. Interurban transportation.
areaDesc.4: No streets are paved with exception of Huntington, Bluffton and Indianapolis Roads. Unrestricted. No water or sewers. Homes not entirely modern.
areaDesc.14: Sparsely settled as indicated; balance 50 percent built up.

areaDesc.3: Highly restricted.
areaDesc.14: Would be an "A" or Green area is equipped with schools and transportation.

areaDesc.3: Schools and transportation good. Near the General Electric Company plant.
areaDesc.4: Railroad and factory dirt and smoke. Adjacent to area D-1.
areaDesc.13: Will hold up as homes for factory workers.
areaDesc.14: Built solidly north of Eby Street, and sparsely settled below.

areaDesc.2: Flat. Spoken of as the "Rolling Mill District."
areaDesc.3: Laborers homes near the job.
areaDesc.4: Low flat section. Poor drainage. Few paved streets. Surrounded by factories and railroads.
areaDesc.14: Cheap box-type houses and bungalows for manual laborers. North of Taylor and east of Morris, the area is 75% built up; the balance is parsely settled.

areaDesc.2: Rolling. Wooded west of Beaver Street.
areaDesc.3: Highly restricted. Near Park. School and transportation facilities good. No homes south of Pettit St.
areaDesc.14: One of the msot desirable sections of the city.

areaDesc.3: Whole area like a park. Main thoroughfare a boulevard. Convenient to churches, schools and transporation. South portion heavily wooded.
areaDesc.4: Lots too narrow of the area -- 40 foot lots with no access to the rear.
areaDesc.14: Excellent area as per questions (3) except for narrowness of lots as per question (4).

areaDesc.3: Schools are good; transportation fair. Most of streets are paved. High ground -- clean section, -- no smoke.
areaDesc.14: Area in white to the south and west has grading, but no development. Growth of the city is toward the south.

areaDesc.3: Paved streets. Schools and transportation good. Near industry.
areaDesc.4: Bordering the negro, industrial and railroad sections. Old part of town; cheap properties; smoke and soot from railroads and industry.
areaDesc.13: Slowly downward. See questions No. 4 and 6-c
areaDesc.14: Negro occupancy of one and one-half block shown in red in northeasternmost section.

areaDesc.3: Close to business center.
areaDesc.4: Old obsolete area, near industry, warehouses and the RR's.

6.a: All types of single family units; no tenements

areaDesc.14: South of Buchanan Street is affected by movement of negroes and aliens from the north of Buchanan. There are at present only a few families that have crossed the line.

areaDesc.3: Good schools and transportation. Paved streets; convenient to civic center. Good high ground. Wooded section. Next to "B" area on the west.
areaDesc.4: Northern part: homes are older -- converting to income property.
areaDesc.14: Southern portion a little newer type -- beginning at Killea Street.

areaDesc.3: Schools, parks and transportation: good. Streets paved.
areaDesc.14: High ground. Clean section, not affected by smoke or soot.

areaDesc.3: Near schools and park. Good transportation. Surrounded by better property.
areaDesc.14: Negro families seem to be of the better sort. Infiltration of negroes slow, if any.

areaDesc.3: Near the General Electric Company. Schools: Fair. Transportation: Good. Near Boulevard area.
areaDesc.13: May maintain its own. Will probably not improve.

areaDesc.3: Convenient to business, schools and churches.
areaDesc.14: Old neighborhood, but well maintained

areaDesc.3: Good transportation and schools. Handy for business. Well kept up.
areaDesc.13: The one block marked INGLEWOOD COURT is 60 percent developed with houses ranging from $13,000 to $20,000. All brick veneer construction. FRENCH AVENUE is built of old cheap homes, ranging from $2,000 to $3,000 on the south side of the street only, -- they face the rear of the Inglewood Court homes. TACOMA STREET and WEST, has higher restrictions than the balance of the area. Area in white to the south is laid out, but not developed.

areaDesc.3: Highly restricted. Wooded area near Park. School and transportation facilities good.
areaDesc.14: There is considerable activity for the size of this area. Very best residential section.

areaDesc.2: Flat. East of Birchwood is rolling, and known as "Harvester Park."
areaDesc.3: Close to the east of factories.
areaDesc.13: It will do well to hold up. Will probably continue to decline.
areaDesc.14: East of Birchwood and south of Pontiac, east of Alexander -- very sparsely developed. Otherwise, 70 percent developed.

areaDesc.3: None
areaDesc.14: Shacks out near the dump and stock yards. North of Railroad tracks -- low and marshy.

areaDesc.2: Flat. Known as "West End" on the west side of the Commercial area.
areaDesc.3: Accessible to the civic center. Schools and transportation are good. Paved - wide streets. Curb stone. Shade trees.
areaDesc.4: Subject to railroad and factory smoke and soot. Converting to apartment district.

5.a: Old families: professional and white collar

areaDesc.14: Large homes in conversion to apartments; old established families moving out.

areaDesc.2: Flat. Called "Bloomingdale" toward the north, and "Nebraska" toward the south -- the dividing line being the Nickel Plate R. R. Tracks.
areaDesc.3: Close to civic center. Schools and transportation good. Parks and paved streets.
areaDesc.4: No restrictions. Factory and Railroad soot and smoke under unfavorable winds. Congested area.
areaDesc.14: Cheap construction

areaDesc.3: Boulevard street. Large lots. Highly restricted.Good schools and transportation.
areaDesc.13: Area is still slowly building up.
areaDesc.14: Development started 25 years ago. Still building expensive, large homes.

areaDesc.3: Parks, Churches; transportation and schools.

5.a: white collar and skilled laboring class es

areaDesc.14: The extremes west end has room for further development.

areaDesc.3: Transportation is fair.
areaDesc.4: Unrestricted. Two central sections not provided with schools.

6.a: Singles: bungalows and 2-story Southern portion: 18 years

areaDesc.14: More thickly settled in the southern sections. Southern sections are paved, and with sidewalks. Northern section in slow development.

areaDesc.2: Wooded. Rolling. Elevation increases to the north.
areaDesc.3: Landscaped Park and stream. Good schools and transportation.

5.a: Professional and other white collar workers

areaDesc.14: Restricted area. Developing north.

areaDesc.3: Close to business center; good transportation and parks; also, schools.
areaDesc.4: Southern portion surrounded by a dyke from Tennessee Ave. south. Flooded in 1913. May flood again; water up to one foot of the top of the dyke in January 1937.
areaDesc.14: Good clean section, free of Railroad and industrial smoke. Large houses are being converted into apartments.

areaDesc.2: Flat. Called "Glassmier Heights." Northern portion is wooded.
areaDesc.3: Good schools. Transportation is fair. East and west streets are paved.

6.a: 3 room garage type, bungalows and 6-room singles 2 story

areaDesc.14: Developed with garage type houses built on rear of lots. Better homes to be built at the front in the future. There is a scattering of more modern home of standard construction.

areaDesc.3: Highly restricted. Very desirable. School and transportation facilities good.
areaDesc.14: West side of Anthony Boulevard is developed with %10,000 to $12,0000 houses. The whole area is improving.

areaDesc.3: Good schools and transportation and other advantages of Area B-4
areaDesc.14: West and north section built up; east section building.

areaDesc.3: Boulevard Street. Large lots. Highly restricted. Good transportation and good schools.
areaDesc.14: Boulevard street. Lots are not so large as in Area 6-B. A very desirable neighborhood.

areaDesc.2: Flat. Southern end known as "South Kensington Park."
areaDesc.3: Streets paved. Transportation good. Near Parks. Convenient to civic center.
areaDesc.4: School facilities are not so good. Low land protected by a dyke.
areaDesc.13: Should hold its own or improve.
areaDesc.14: The five modernistic cement block houses have not been sold. Lower section somewhat affected by odors from the river when the water is low.

areaDesc.3: Near parks. Schools and transportation: good. Close to civic center. Streets paved. Beautiful filtration plant area and river banks.
areaDesc.4: Older area. No chance for future improvement.
areaDesc.14: Large houses being converted into apartments.
